group_1.textRight: We're here.
Fierbois, the home of Saint Catherine's@Church.

group_1.textLeft: Yes! I'll show you the way.
Unfortunately, the church bell was damaged@during battle.

group_1.textRight: Oh. Well, there may not be a bell to ring,@but...
Let's follow Liz's instructions and head@to the church.
So this is Saint Catherine's Church.
Right!
If anyone is there, please answer us!

group_1.narration: You must be the girls Liz told me about.
Welcome, O Magical Girls from a foreign@land.

group_1.textRight: That voice, who...?

group_1.textLeft: Hey, Pernelle. It's been a while!

group_1.narration: Because I exist outside of La Pucelle's@dream and cannot traverse within that space.

group_1.textRight: You're outside of the dream?

group_1.textLeft: She's currently in the real world.
But it seems like she can still help us!
She must've been the one Liz was talking@about after all.

group_1.narration: Verily. Somehow your voices are able@to cross over and reach me.
But keeping this rift in the dream@Labyrinth open is very difficult...

group_1.textRight: Pernelle!
We want to wake Darc up from this dream.
Please tell us about the Sacred Bell!

group_1.narration: Before Darc was put into a magical sleep,@she heard a certain church bell ring out.
For the maiden to awaken, she must ring@that same bell herself within the dream.

group_1.textRight: At the same church? Where is that?

group_1.narration: In the real world, Darc was within the@city of Orléans, fighting to liberate it,@when she fell into a slumber.
Therefore, the bell you search for@must be the one affixed to the@Cathedral of the Holy Cross.

group_1.textRight: Yes, that's all we needed.
If we free Darc and have her ring the bell...
This nightmare of her's will be over!
No.
That's not enough!
We're stuck in an endless night because Darc@has fallen into despair.
Even if she wakes up from her dream,@without Liz―
She is?

group_1.narration: But she has lost sight of the light and is@unable to escape the world of darkness.
